Job Title: Director of Capture with Security Clearance

Location: Tysons Corner, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Overview Director of Capture Location: Tysons Corner, VA Clearance: Secret The Capture Director functions as a "conductor of the orchestra" in large-deal captures, solely responsible to facilitate a multi-disciplinary approach that ties the bid solution from the technical approach through pric ing strategy, and ensures all corporate business development processes for operations, security, contracts, recruiting, and finance are adhered to across the full team. The Capture Director functions in a conceptual sense as a "solutions architect", tracing customer needs and requirements from early in the bid cycle through final submission. They are a complete utility player, having insight and understanding of each of the corporate supporting functions, with the ability to backfill and and backstop any obstacles or challenges that threaten the bid and employs strategies to overcome those obstacles. The Director of Capture should be comfortable leading a capture effort no matter the agency, line of business, or level of complexity, as this is a rotational position supporting bids across the totality of Integral's core competencies. This position is based in the DC/MD/VA area and reports to the Chief Strategy Officer . Travel may be required to cultivate new and ongoing business endeavors. The successful candidate will balance a hybrid work schedule that includes telework and in-office work. Responsibilities

In partnership with the Director of Business Development, the Director of Capture interfaces with the customer community to understand requirements and needs and identifies shaping opportunities to influence final RFP to enhance PWinBuilds capture plan as an informational document to inform proposal team of customer objectives, solutions, and key messages; assists Proposal Manager in the writing/shaping of proposal documents when neededDrives pricing strategyDrives teaming strategy and finalizes teaming arrangementsObtains and applies an understanding of the competitive landscape and adjusts solutions, as neededAnalyzes the organization's strategic plans and productsConducts initial "blue team" storyboard mockup that outlines initial solutions and includes win strategy, development of major themes and proposal strengthsPrepares and conducts decision meetings and interfaces with senior management for internal approvalsAnalyzes the DRFP against Win Themes/Discriminators, Refined Technical Management, Cost/Price, Past Performance BaselinesPrepares B&P estimates and ROI justifications for assigned captures.Leads and manages execution of capture activities to ensure costs, schedules, and performance goals are met.Using provided tools and guidelines, classifies the win probability, funding probability and bid/performance risks and establishes appropriate risk management strategies.Interfaces with industry peers and evaluates/recommends teaming arrangements. Qualifications Required: A minimum of ten years of Capture Management experience with proven capability to execute a capture strategy and win pursuitsBachelor's degree in business or related discipline, or a combination of education and experienceSecret ClearanceProven track record of pursuing and winning various bids of 100M+Experienced with rapid IDIQ task order processes and responses to a defined timelineAbility to work in a matrixed, fast-paced team environmentDemonstrated ability to develop proposal objectives from vaguely defined requirementsEffective oral, written, and presentation communication skills coupled with the ability to establish and maintain productive customer and industry participant networks are essentialEfficiency in the use of Microsoft (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) is requiredExperience supporting a diverse set of customers, especially the Department of Defense, including intelligence programs customersAbility to multi-task, organize, and prioritize multiple on-going projects Preferred:TS/SCI Clearance Company Overview Integral partners with federal defense, intelligence, and civilian leaders to tackle their most important challenges and deliver positive outcomes. Since our founding in 1998, we have helped clients leverage existing and emerging technologies to transform their enterprises, empower growth, drive innovation, and build sustainable success. The forward-leaning solutions we deliver are tailored to each mission with a focus on keeping our nation safe and secure. Integral is headquartered in Tysons Corner, VA and serves clients throughout the country. We offer a comprehensive total rewards package including paid parental leave and immediate vesting in our 401(k). Give us a try and become part of a curated group of professionals at Integral Federal! Our package also includes:Medical, Dental & Vision InsuranceFlexible Spending AccountsShort-Term and Long-Term Disability InsuranceLife InsurancePaid Time Off & HolidaysEarned Bonuses & AwardsProfessional Training ReimbursementPaid ParkingEmployee Assistance Program Integral is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, military/veteran status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class.

Experience Level (if available): Director
